intro: Nassauvia oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-leaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value and adaptability to arid environments make it a notable species in its native range.
